item.title: Coronavirus: Obama criticises Trump administration's virus response
item.description: The former US president says top officials "aren't even pretending to be in charge" amid the crisis.

item.title: One every eight minutes: India's missing children
item.description: Many of those who vanish are trafficked and exploited, but there's little public outrage.

item.title: #LastNormalPhoto: Thousands share last images before lockdown
item.description: We asked you to post your last "normal" photo before coronavirus. A lot of you replied.

item.title: Du Wei: Chinese ambassador to Israel found dead at home
item.description: Initial findings suggest there was no foul play in the death of Du Wei at his home near Tel Aviv.

item.title: How coronavirus is driving a revolution in travel
item.description: Manchester is spearheading a new effort to create space for walking and cycling.

item.title: Pakistan girls shot dead over mobile video
item.description: The teenage Pakistani girls were reportedly killed by a relative after video showed them with a man.

item.title: Israel swears in unity government after long political crisis
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his rival Benny Gantz agree to share power amid virus crisis.

item.title: Hash oil factory blast injures 11 firefighters in Los Angeles
item.description: Crews tackling a blaze are hit by a fireball and have to run through a wall of flame to safety.

item.title: Steve Linick: Democrats probe Trump's firing of inspector general
item.description: The president's firing of the state department's inspector general will be investigated by Congress.

item.title: Félicien Kabuga: Rwanda genocide survivors happy with arrest
item.description: A widows' group says "everyone has been waiting" for his apprehension, 26 years after the slaughter.

item.title: Jorge Armenta: Mexican journalist killed in 'armed attack'
item.description: Jorge Armenta, director of Medios Obson, had received threats and was under government protection.

item.title: German Bundesliga returns: What did football's new reality look like?
item.description: The German Bundesliga restarts and gives a glimpse into what the Premier League and other top leagues may look like.

item.title: India extends coronavirus lockdown by two weeks
item.description: The country's major cities will remain under strict restrictions, with some relaxation elsewhere.

item.title: Coronavirus: Barack Obama and LeBron James congratulate US graduates
item.description: Many schools have had to cancel ceremonies, so famous faces have sent the students messages.

item.title: Coronavirus: How face masks are becoming fashionable
item.description: With governments recommending face masks, the fashion world is ensuring they remain on trend.

item.title: Meet the baby orangutans learning to climb trees
item.description: Baby orangutans are learning new skills from their human surrogate parents.

item.title: Eurovision 2020: Highlights from celebration show, Europe Shine A Light
item.description: Eurovision stars come together on the night that this year's cancelled contest would have taken place.

item.title: Coronavirus: Capturing isolation on New Zealand's Stewart Island
item.description: As the country emerges from lockdown, a photographer has documented life on rugged Stewart Island.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can gaming help stop lockdown loneliness?
item.description: Gamers like Millicent say their online adventures are helping them stay connected to friends in lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: Your pictures of working at home
item.description: Our readers reveal the new normal of life during a pandemic.

item.title: Actor Leslie Jordan on his lockdown Instagram fame
item.description: The Emmy Award-winning star's videos have helped him to hit more than four million followers.

item.title: Coronavirus: Are Italians losing faith in the EU?
item.description: As Italy slowly emerges from coronavirus lockdown many citizens feel let down by the EU.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why Taiwan won't have a seat at the virus talks
item.description: As the world meets to tackle the coronavirus crisis, one of the most successful countries is not invited.

item.title: Letter from Africa: Spare a thought for stranded migrants
item.description: Ismail Einashe writes that migrants are facing a tougher time since the outbreak of coronavirus.

item.title: Plinofficial: Russian rapper who loved dollars arrested by FBI
item.description: How a young rapper from Siberia became the subject of an FBI probe into global cybercriminals.

item.title: How Covid-19 is threatening Central America's economic lifeline
item.description: Many communities rely heavily on remittances but these are drying up due to coronavirus lockdowns.

item.title: Gedhun Choekyi Niyima: Tibetan Buddhism's 'reincarnated' leader who disappeared aged six
item.description: Twenty-five years after the Panchen Lama disappeared, Tibetans abroad urge China to reveal his fate.

item.title: Coronavirus: Two Americas in the nation's capital
item.description: Social and racial divides play out in Washington DC as the city, and nation, grapple with Covid-19.

item.title: Bundesliga: 'Bizarre, sterile and eerie' - what it was really like inside one of Germany's 'Ghost Games'
item.description: The Bundesliga returned to action this weekend and German football writer Constantin Eckner tells BBC Sport his experience inside one of football's 'Ghost Games'.

item.title: Uefa has 'concrete plan' to finish European football season 'in August'
item.description: Uefa president Aleksander Cerefin says it has a "concrete plan" for finishing the season this summer.

item.title: NFL's Deandre Baker and Quinton Dunbar surrender after robbery charge
item.description: The two players turned themselves in to police in Florida following charges for armed robbery and aggravated assault.

item.title: Coronavirus could cost top-flight European clubs £3.5bn
item.description: Top-flight European clubs stand to lose more than £3.5bn because of Covid-19 even if all the major domestic leagues and competitions reach their conclusion.

item.title: UFC in Jacksonville: Looking back at landmark week as MMA bounces back
item.description: As the UFC concludes its triple header of events in Jacksonville, we look at what was different and how future fights might be staged.

item.title: Haaland scores in Dortmund win as Bundesliga returns
item.description: Erling Braut Haaland scores for Borussia Dortmund as they mark the return of the Bundesliga during the coronavirus outbreak with a convincing derby win over Schalke.

item.title: Sebastian Vettel: How much do you know about his time at Ferrari?
item.description: Sebastian Vettel and Ferrari's love affair has come to an end - but how much of the four-time world champion's time at the Scuderia can you remember?

item.title: Coronavirus: South Africa's alcohol and cigarette lockdown
item.description: In South Africa, illegal sellers are defying the prohibition on buying alcohol and cigarettes.

item.title: Tracking the outbreak in maps and charts
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can China test all of Wuhan in only 10 days?
item.description: Officials vowed to test all 11 million Wuhan residents in 10 days, but it appears they need longer.

item.title: Aarogya Setu: Why India's Covid-19 contact tracing app is controversial
item.description: Aarogya Setu, India's contact tracing app, has crossed 100 million downloads, but has raised concerns.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why 'shark attacks' won’t go down as Covid deaths
item.description: Infowars claims about testing, the viral body bag video in Brazil and other claims fact-checked.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'We're in the experimental phase'
item.description: As lockdown is eased, we all become participants in a vast, very cautious observational experiment, experts say.

item.title: Coronavirus: How exposed is your job?
item.description: See how your job compares to others in terms of exposure to disease and closeness to other people.

item.title: Joshna Maharaj - The chef who lost her sense of smell
item.description: Chef Joshna Maharaj couldn't smell for years. Now she's working to regain some of what she lost.

item.title: Eurovision tribute by Fizz members and BBC correspondent
item.description: May 12 would have been the Eurovision semi-finals but the competition was cancelled due to coronavirus.

item.title: The faded beauty of abandoned cars across Europe and the US
item.description: Photographer Dieter Klein searched Europe and the US to discover cars lost to time.

item.title: Coronavirus and Antarctica: 'Isolated within isolation'
item.description: Why the people on the only continent without a recorded case of coronavirus are in lockdown.
